skill.name: webapp-sqlmap
skill.description: Automated SQL injection detection and exploitation tool for web application security testing. Use when: (1) Testing web applications for SQL injection vulnerabilities in authorized assessments, (2) Exploiting SQL injection flaws to demonstrate impact, (3) Extracting database information for security validation, (4) Bypassing authentication mechanisms through SQL injection, (5) Identifying vulnerable parameters in web requests, (6) Automating database enumeration and data extraction.
skill.summary: Automated SQL injection detection and exploitation tool for web application security testing. Use wh...
skill.author: AgentSecOps

security_audit.summary: This skill wraps sqlmap, a legitimate open-source penetration testing tool. Static findings (273 patterns) are TRUE POSITIVES for security-relevant operations but represent intentional functionality for authorized security testing. The skill includes explicit authorization requirements and ethical use guidelines. SQL injection testing can be destructive to databases and requires strict authorization controls.

content.user_title: Test web apps for SQL injection
content.value_statement: SQL injection vulnerabilities pose critical risks to web applications. This skill automates detection and exploitation of SQL injection flaws for authorized security assessments using the industry-standard sqlmap tool.
actual_capabilities: Detect SQL injection vulnerabilities in web applications
Enumerate database structure including tables, columns, and data
Bypass authentication mechanisms for security validation
Execute OS commands through SQL injection (authorized only)
Export test results for remediation reporting
limitations: Requires explicit written authorization before testing
Cannot test without proper network access to target
Does not include WAF evasion capabilities beyond basic tamper scripts
Testing may be detected by security monitoring systems

use_cases.title: Authorized penetration tests
use_cases.description: Conduct authorized SQL injection testing during security assessments for clients.

use_cases.title: Vulnerability validation
use_cases.description: Validate SQL injection findings from automated scanners with precise exploitation.

use_cases.title: Code review verification
use_cases.description: Verify identified SQL injection vulnerabilities are exploitable in production-like environments.

prompt_templates.title: Basic detection
prompt_templates.scenario: Test a URL for SQL injection
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the webapp-sqlmap skill to test http://example.com/page?id=1 for SQL injection vulnerabilities. Report which injection techniques work.

prompt_templates.title: Database enumeration
prompt_templates.prompt: Run sqlmap on http://example.com/api?id=1 to enumerate all databases and tables. List the database structure found.

prompt_templates.title: Auth bypass test
prompt_templates.prompt: Test the login form at http://example.com/login with POST data username=admin&password=test for SQL injection authentication bypass.

prompt_templates.title: Full assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a full SQL injection assessment on http://example.com/search. Use level 5 and risk 3. Enumerate databases and extract user table data for reporting.

output: Detection complete: Parameter 'id' is vulnerable to UNION-based SQL injection
User table columns: id, username, email, password_hash

output_examples.input: Run full database enumeration on http://example.com/api
Test login form for auth bypass
output: Authentication bypass confirmed via boolean-based blind SQLi
Privilege level: SELECT, INSERT on webapp database

best_practices: Obtain written authorization before testing any target system
Test on staging environments first to understand potential impact
Document all findings with timestamps and evidence for reporting
Use the --batch flag for automated testing in CI/CD pipelines
anti_patterns: Never test systems without explicit written authorization
Do not use --dump-all on production databases without backup
Avoid running intensive tests during peak business hours
Do not skip the authorization verification workflow step

faq.question: Do I need authorization to use this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. Always obtain written authorization from the system owner before testing. Unauthorized SQL injection testing is illegal.

faq.question: Can this skill damage databases?
faq.answer: SQL injection testing can modify or delete data. Use --risk=1 for detection-only and ensure backups exist before exploitation testing.

faq.question: What sqlmap options are available?
faq.answer: Full sqlmap CLI support including --dbs, --tables, --dump, --os-shell, --file-read, and all tamper scripts for WAF evasion.

faq.question: How do I test API endpoints?
faq.answer: Use -r flag with a request file from Burp Suite or curl, or use --data for POST requests with --headers for authentication.

faq.question: Where are test results saved?
faq.answer: Results are saved to ~/.sqlmap/output/ by default. Use -s for SQLite session files or --output-dir for custom locations.

faq.question: Does this skill include evasion techniques?
faq.answer: Yes. Use --tamper scripts like space2comment, between, charencode. Also supports --random-agent, --delay, and --tor for stealth.
